important_tips.1: Adhere to taking insulin in the correct doses and at the appropriate times.
important_tips.2: Regularly monitor blood sugar levels, especially before and after meals and exercise.
important_tips.3: Eat balanced meals containing complex carbohydrates, proteins, and healthy fats.
important_tips.4: Avoid simple sugars that cause a rapid spike in blood sugar.
important_tips.5: Drink plenty of water to stay hydrated and prevent high blood sugar.
important_tips.6: Exercise moderately while monitoring blood sugar levels before and after workouts.
important_tips.7: Carry a carbohydrate-rich snack during physical activities to prevent low blood sugar.
important_tips.8: Consult a doctor regularly to adjust insulin doses and diet.

meal_plan.lunch: Boiled chicken with whole wheat pasta

suitable_exercises.1: Walking or light jogging (30-45 minutes daily).
suitable_exercises.2: Resistance training (light weightlifting) to improve insulin sensitivity.
suitable_exercises.3: Yoga to reduce stress and regulate blood sugar.
suitable_exercises.4: Swimming and cycling as low-impact exercises on the joints.

type_1_diabetes.note: Always check blood sugar before and after workouts and carry a carbohydrate-rich snack to prevent sudden hypoglycemia.

important_tips.1: Reduce consumption of simple carbohydrates such as white sugar and baked goods.
important_tips.2: Eat fiber-rich foods like vegetables, legumes, and oats to improve blood sugar control.
important_tips.3: Exercise regularly to improve insulin sensitivity.
important_tips.4: Lose excess weight if present, as it helps improve the body's insulin response.
important_tips.5: Reduce processed foods, soft drinks, and sweetened juices.
important_tips.6: Choose healthy fat sources like olive oil, nuts, and avocado.
important_tips.7: Divide meals into small portions throughout the day to prevent blood sugar spikes.
important_tips.8: Drink plenty of water to stay hydrated and reduce hunger.

suitable_exercises.2: Strength training (weightlifting) to increase muscle mass and burn calories.
suitable_exercises.3: HIIT (High-Intensity Interval Training) to burn fat and improve fitness.
suitable_exercises.4: Stretching and yoga to reduce stress and improve circulation.

type_2_diabetes.note: Exercise helps reduce insulin resistance and improves the body's response to insulin, so it must be done regularly.
